Other Information.Additional Info: Propylene resides near the window and passes through with cooperative pyrazine rotation.
Propane is located away from the window at the cavity center, requiring larger pyrazine rotations and anion reorientation to pass, which slows its diffusion significantly.

Sieving Mechanism: Size exclusion at sub-nanometer scale combined with host dynamics

Experimental Validation.Method: Breakthrough experiment, GCMC simulation, single-crystal X-ray diffraction
Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: CO2/N2 selectivity: Not Reported, Propylene/propane selectivity > 99% at 1.3 bar, 298 K

Other Information.Additional Info: The material shows excellent propylene/propane separation due to differential guest location by host dynamics, particularly the rotation of (NbOF5)2− anions that locates propane away from the window.
Propylene resides near the window and can pass through with cooperative pyrazine rotation.
Propane also resides near the window in SIFSIX-3-Ni and does not trigger anion rotation, allowing it to pass through the channel.

Sieving Mechanism: Kinetic differentiation without significant host distortion

Experimental Validation.Performance Metrics: Adsorbs both propane (45 mg/g) and propylene (76 mg/g) at 298 K, 1 bar

Other Information.Additional Info: Unlike NbOFFIVE-1-Ni, SIFSIX-3-Ni does not exclude propane and shows no induced host distortion caused by either guest molecule.
